Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: We recognise the importance of education in helping our people develop personally and professionally. To support this, we established our Education Assistance Program. This program is specifically tailored to assist employees in pursuing voluntary academic studies that are aligned with AltiumÃ¢ÂÂs business requirements. As part of our effort to incentivise employees to participate in voluntary continuing education, we provide financial assistance grants for programs leading to formal qualifications.

Diversity of governance bodies and employees
column13: In FY23, we launched the AWE Employee Resource Group. A core group of employee volunteers leads it. It serves to lift women in our organisation through monthly programming, community activities, and connections between employees and external partners like Women in Electronics (WE), a California-based non-profit organisation dedicated to expanding the opportunities for women and diverse talent in electronics and related industries that represent end-user markets. Materials and activities are primarily focused on content related to women in leadership and are available to all employees, regardless of role or gender.
column20: AWE Employee Resource Group, Women Empowerment, Diversity

column6: Diversity of governance bodies and employees
column13: A key AWE program during FY23 was Altium WomenÃ¢ÂÂs Month in March, scheduled to coincide with WomenÃ¢ÂÂs History Month in the US, and March 8, global International WomenÃ¢ÂÂs Day. Dedicated to honouring and reinforcing the value and importance of women in leadership roles at Altium, WomenÃ¢ÂÂs Month activities were open to employees across the globe and encompassed a series of internal talks hosted and led by women leaders at Altium to connect, support, educating and inspiring their female colleagues. WomanÃ¢ÂÂs Month activities were highly attended worldwide, with engaging personal narratives, advice on career advancement, and open Q&A with attendees. This month-long event was one of the most positively received events held in FY23, with requests for an ongoing series in FY24.

column7: Altium supports the protection of human rights and is guided by fundamental principles like the United Nations Universal Declaration of Human Rights. Altium strives to support human rights through the supply chain by encouraging supplier practices that actively identify, assess and manage human rights issues.

column6: Operations and suppliers ar significant risk for incidents of forced or compulsory labor
column9: Modern Slavery Roadmap and Action Plan
column13: In FY23, Altium engaged an external expert in human rights to help us develop a forward-looking Modern Slavery Roadmap and Action Plan. The Roadmap set a strategic pathway and examined how we will continue addressing modern slavery risk. It also discussed developing a remediation plan to help us work with vendors to address human rights issues, as the United Nations Guiding Principles on Business and Human Rights outlined.

Employee training on human rights policies or procedures
column7: All new employees are onboarded with a focus on our values, expected behaviours and dedicated training. It includes training on our Code of Conduct, anti-bribery and corruption, ethical behaviour, human rights, diversity, and inclusion. Our training is offered virtually through Skillsoft, and employees maintain their own learning and development dashboard. During FY23, 100% of new starters completed their onboarding training.

column13: The Altium Education program was launched in March 2022. By June 2022, it had supported approximately 20,000 students. During the FY23 reporting period, an additional 52,000 students joined Altium Education across 130 countries.

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: This targeted program provides free access to Altium Designer Pro and Altium 365 and training for colleges/universities and emerging engineering students in India. The program goal is to expand on the base of 3000 Indian students currently enrolled in Altium Education, noting that an estimated 240,000 Indian students graduate from Electronic / Electrical Engineering studies each year.\t

New suppliers that were screened using social criteria
column7: During the FY23 Reporting Period, we formalised our procurement processes further, particularly by seeking to ensure supplier alignment with our SCC. By the end of FY23, 10 of our top 30 suppliers had specifically acknowledged our SCC in writing. Our top 30 suppliers' balance has its Supplier Codes of Conduct or equivalent, which we have reviewed to ensure alignment on issues relating to modern slavery.

column6: Negative social impacts in the supply chain and actions taken
column13: An important step in developing the Roadmap was Modern Slavery 101 training conducted during FY23. The training was held to raise internal awareness of modern slavery and modern slavery risk, as well as our modern slavery obligations, and to disseminate and receive feedback on the findings of our modern slavery risk assessment. We believe that a greater understanding of modern slavery across our business will ultimately help underwrite the effectiveness of action planning.

column7: Political contributions are donations to political parties, organisations, candidates, elected representatives, and other government officials. They are prohibited except with the prior approval of the Chair of the Board or the CEO.

column13: Altium made a significant step forward in cyber security in May of this year with the SOC2 Type 2 certification for Altium 365. This certification involved Altium completing the examination of controls and procedures that have been put in place to ensure their effectiveness. Regular annual assessments will follow up on AltiumÃ¢ÂÂs commitment to platform security.

column6: Substantiated complaints concerning breaches of customer privacy and losses of customer data
column13: During FY22, Altium launched the internal Security Bug Bounty program to strengthen our security posture further, and we have maintained the program in FY23. The program continued to work effectively. Our people detected several security bugs, each of which our Engineering team was able to address and remediate promptly.

column6: Substantiated complaints concerning breaches of customer privacy and losses of customer data
column13: The Altium 365 disaster recovery program, which relies on a robust technical environment and reliable restoration capability, ensures that services are appropriately backed up, recoverable, and available. Altium regularly tests backup and recovery mechanisms for critical systems to ensure adequate Recovery Time Objectives (RTOs) and Recovery Point Objectives (RPOs) are met. AltiumÃ¢ÂÂs critical systems are calibrated to ensure the Company can meet and respond to disasters within our target RTOs and RPOs.
